summary: What this Tumblr Bullshit means for the SanSan Secret Santa
title: What this Tumblr Bullshit means for the SanSan Secret Santa
body:
With all the drama going around Tumblr recently I thought I would make a post explaining what all this means for the exchange.

First and foremost: THE EVENT IS STILL HAPPENING. Nothing will stop the event from happening not even this website going to hell in a hand basket.

Second, if you are worried you won’t be able to post your gift here on Tumblr then I suggest posting it on AO3/ff.net or deviantart or any other site I’m not thinking of and then just making a post with the link here on Tumblr. So if you don’t have an account with one of these sites then I suggest signing up now. Also it was brought to my attention that posts with links might not appear in the tags, if that is true then I would pop in with your giftee and message them on where the can fine their gift. 

Third, if your account gets flagged or deleted or you don’t think you will be able to access it on the 22nd then message me. You will still post the gift on a site and I’ll post a link to it on this blog, revealing who you are and who’s Santa you were. 

I believe I covered everything, but if you have any other questions don’t hesitate in asking!

summary: I have a question for you. Vanity Fair just confirmed that Jon is in love with Dany. How is your delusional ass doing? 💁‍♀️😂
question: I have a question for you. Vanity Fair just confirmed that Jon is in love with Dany. How is your delusional ass doing? 💁‍♀️😂
answer:
Oh hi there nonny,

My “delusional ass” has never been better, thanks for asking. Your ass, on the other hand, seems to be suffering of a severe case of pettiness and insecurity. lol

You really don’t have anything better to do with your time? Really? Like, why not use your time and energy on making edits and gifsets, or writing fanfics and metas, or drawing and creating fanarts etc. for your faves, instead of going anon into people’s asks and behaving like a lil sh*t? smh 😂

Like, I don’t mind messages like these, please keep em coming, they don’t affect me one bit, they amuse me more than anything.. because it just goes to show you that you are insecure and Jōnsa triggers y’all to the point that when you receive a piece of info about Jōnerys you’re all up into our asks “bragging” about it and being like, “Omg see? See?!! You’re a confirmed delulu! hahaha.” lmao

I have never heard nor seen Jōnrya shippers being bothered, bullied and attacked by Jōnerys shippers the way we are. And that is because everyone knows that Jōnrya is never going to happen due to the strong and real sibling bond and relationship Jon and Arya have always had/shared since they were very little (which means that the ship isn’t a threat to Jōnerys), and thus, unlike Jonsa shippers, Jōnrya shippers are being left alone and are completely ignored by Jōnerys shippers… and that says well, A LOT.

Subconsciously y’all know Jonsa is happening and Jōnerys will sink before even having properly sailed and it shows because that’s why you need reassurance, confirmation and validation and jump at us whenever you think you’re getting it from interviews or articles. lmao

So yeah, my “delulu” ass couldn’t give fewer fluffs about your stupid Vanity Fair article, written by a biased Jōnerys/Dāny stan that is known to dislike Sansa and Jonsa, just like you wouldn’t give two fluffs about an article written by a biased Jonsa/Sansa stan that is known to dislike Dāny, am I right? 🤗

Winter is here,

and so is Jonsa ❄️💙

summary:
*Jon and Rickon have locked themselves in a closet to escape Sansa*
Sansa: Come out of their right now!
Jon: No!
*Sansa huffs...
body:
*Jon and Rickon have locked themselves in a closet to escape Sansa*

Sansa: Come out of their right now!

Jon: No!

*Sansa huffs and walks away*

Jon: *to Rickon* Guess I showed her who’s boss in this family.

tags: sansa stark is better than you
summary: At her core, Sansa represents mercy and grace in a violent, revenge obsessed world. It's why she sings the Mother's hymn to...
body:
At her core, Sansa represents mercy and grace in a violent, revenge obsessed world. It’s why she sings the Mother’s hymn to Sandor instead of a romantic song, why she feels sorry for him rather than hate him despite his cruel remarks. It’s why she would rather exile the Kingsguard who left her covered in bruises instead of execute him. It’s why she knows fear is a terrible way to rule subjects. It’s why she’s kind to people who resent or hurt her. Sansa is flawed, but she exudes grace when it would be easier and more satisfying in the moment to show ugliness.

I’ll take that any day over your violent Mary Sues.

At her core, Sansa represents mercy and grace in a violent, revenge obsessed world. It’s why she sings the Mother’s hymn to Sandor instead of a romantic song, why she feels sorry for him rather than hate him despite his cruel remarks. It’s why she would rather exile the Kingsguard who left her covered in bruises instead of execute him. It’s why she knows fear is a terrible way to rule subjects. It’s why she’s kind to people who resent or hurt her. Sansa is flawed, but she exudes grace when it would be easier and more satisfying in the moment to show ugliness.

I’ll take that any day over your violent Mary Sues.

summary: you know how george said people who think jon and dany are the entire focus of books are missing 90% of the story. i think the...
body: you know how george said people who think jon and dany are the entire focus of books are missing 90% of the story. i think the same thing applies to people who ignore sansa and reduce her to the spare stark or a love interest. you end up missing a lot of george’s themes about what it takes to be a leader, about compassion, about why underhanded tactics only lead to short term gains, about the different kinds of resistance. we see the deconstruction of so many tropes from knighthood to princess in towers to machiavellianism. sansa actively resists taking on a more cynical view of the world. she uses skills that are looked down upon in both our world and westeros. she affects and influences multiple storylines without ever being a warrior archetype. ignoring sansa means you end up ignoring the heart of the story.

trail.content: you know how george said people who think jon and dany are the entire focus of books are missing 90% of the story. i think the same thing applies to people who ignore sansa and reduce her to the spare stark or a love interest. you end up missing a lot of george’s themes about what it takes to be a leader, about compassion, about why underhanded tactics only lead to short term gains, about the different kinds of resistance. we see the deconstruction of so many tropes from knighthood to princess in towers to machiavellianism. sansa actively resists taking on a more cynical view of the world. she uses skills that are looked down upon in both our world and westeros. she affects and influences multiple storylines without ever being a warrior archetype. ignoring sansa means you end up ignoring the heart of the story.
